reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Kick FGM Out of Singida: Two years project 2019-2021

description.narrative: Tanzania Demographic and Health Survey (TDHS 2015-2016) indicated that the percentage of women aged 15-49 reporting to have ever experienced physical sexual or emotional violence committed by their husbands or partners in Singida region was 44%. The same s urvey also found that 63.6% of the surveyed men and 61.6% of women in Singida thought that a husband was justified in hitting or beating his wife for specific reasons. It was further revealed that prevalence of FGM in Singida region was 31% for women aged 15-49 years. The survey further reported that 51.5% of the female children in the region have had FGM before the age of 1 year. The project will support implementation of National Gender Policy of 2000 which seeks to redress gender gaps and inequalities to all citizens. Moreover the project will contribute to the implementation of the National Child Policy 2008 that focuses on the realization of children?s rights including the rights to life survival and development and protection from violence. Furthermore the project will strengthen reporting systems for FGM/GBV cases and promote effective implementation of the National Plan of Action for Ending Violence against Women and Children (NPA-VAWC 2017/18- 2021/22).The project will contribute to the achievement o f the following results ?Community members with an increased recognize FGM as a crime unacceptable and harmful traditional practice that should be rejected and stopped. ?Increased responsiveness of LGA Law enforcers on reported cases of FGM in Singida DC a nd Municipal. ?Strengthened systems and structures for reporting and responding to FGM/VAWC cases.The specific approaches to achieve above results include the following; Awareness-raising capacity buidling trainings Information and Communication Technol ogy (ICTs) e.g. ESTL uses ICT-Mobile data tracking system (http://estl.or.tz/sms/index.php Use of Cinema shows about the consequences of FGM/VAWG to promote behavioural change among community members in the Singida region. The direct beneficiaries of the p roject at least 43712 people in Singida Municipality (14351males and 29361 females) and another 52678 in Singida Rural (26756 males and 25922 females) will be reached by the project both directly and indirectly. They will be reached in 50 different village s from 9 wards of Singida Rural and 6 wards from Singida Urban.ESTL is main implimenting agency throgh other stakehoders.

Tanzania Demographic and Health Survey (TDHS 2015-2016) indicated that the percentage of women aged 15-49 reporting to have ever experienced physical sexual or emotional violence committed by their husbands or partners in Singida region was 44%. The same s urvey also found that 63.6% of the surveyed men and 61.6% of women in Singida thought that a husband was justified in hitting or beating his wife for specific reasons. It was further revealed that prevalence of FGM in Singida region was 31% for women aged 15-49 years. The survey further reported that 51.5% of the female children in the region have had FGM before the age of 1 year. The project will support implementation of National Gender Policy of 2000 which seeks to redress gender gaps and inequalities to all citizens. Moreover the project will contribute to the implementation of the National Child Policy 2008 that focuses on the realization of children?s rights including the rights to life survival and development and protection from violence. Furthermore the project will strengthen reporting systems for FGM/GBV cases and promote effective implementation of the National Plan of Action for Ending Violence against Women and Children (NPA-VAWC 2017/18- 2021/22).The project will contribute to the achievement o f the following results ?Community members with an increased recognize FGM as a crime unacceptable and harmful traditional practice that should be rejected and stopped. ?Increased responsiveness of LGA Law enforcers on reported cases of FGM in Singida DC a nd Municipal. ?Strengthened systems and structures for reporting and responding to FGM/VAWC cases.The specific approaches to achieve above results include the following; Awareness-raising capacity buidling trainings Information and Communication Technol ogy (ICTs) e.g. ESTL uses ICT-Mobile data tracking system (http://estl.or.tz/sms/index.php Use of Cinema shows about the consequences of FGM/VAWG to promote behavioural change among community members in the Singida region. The direct beneficiaries of the p roject at least 43712 people in Singida Municipality (14351males and 29361 females) and another 52678 in Singida Rural (26756 males and 25922 females) will be reached by the project both directly and indirectly. They will be reached in 50 different village s from 9 wards of Singida Rural and 6 wards from Singida Urban.ESTL is main implimenting agency throgh other stakehoders.

tag.narrative: Strengthening of the rights and status of women and girls is the main priority area in this activ ity
